channel.title: Events on AI Timeline
channel.description: Recent content in Events on AI Timeline

item.title: MrBeast AI Thumbnail Tool Controversy
item.description: MrBeast, faced backlash for launching an AI thumbnail tool that allowed users to generate thumbnails by referencing existing YouTube channels without consent, leading to accusations of plagiarism. He quickly pulled the offering

item.title: Deepseek R1 Release
item.description: Brief description of the AI event and its significance.

item.title: GPT-4o Release
item.description: On May 13, 2024, OpenAI announced GPT-4o, a new flagship model that can reason across audio, vision, and text in real time. It is available in the free tier and to Plus users with higher message limits.

item.title: Gemini 1.0 Release
item.description: Google introduced Gemini 1.0, a multimodal model (formerly known as Bard) that incorporates text, images, and code to enhance Google’s search and productivity tools.

item.title: DALL·E 3 Release
item.description: OpenAI released DALL·E 3, a text-to-image model that produces high-quality illustrations and integrates with ChatGPT for prompt generation.

item.title: Llama 2 Release
item.description: Meta released Llama 2, an open-source large language model that quickly became a popular foundation for research and commercial use.

item.title: Claude Release
item.description: On March 14, 2023, Anthropic introduced Claude, an AI assistant built using Constitutional AI training methods. Claude was designed to be helpful, harmless, and honest, with a focus on safety and alignment. The model demonstrated strong conversational abilities while being trained to avoid harmful outputs through constitutional AI techniques.

item.title: GPT-4 Release
item.description: On March 14, 2023, OpenAI released GPT-4, a large multimodal model that can solve difficult problems with greater accuracy than previous models, thanks to its broader general knowledge and problem-solving abilities. It can accept image and text inputs and emit text outputs.

item.title: ChatGPT Release
item.description: On November 30, 2022, OpenAI launched ChatGPT, a conversational AI model that quickly gained widespread popularity for its ability to generate human-like text, answer questions, and assist with a wide range of tasks.
